intro: Cyrtandra × tantalusensis, commonly known as the Tantalus hybrid, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from red to orange. The plant is a hybrid between Cyrtandra hawaiiensis and Cyrtandra taitensis, showcasing a blend of traits from both parent species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
